channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The EU indicates it won't accept the U.S.'s Russia-Ukraine peace deal
item.description: The U.S. has proposed a peace plan for Russia and Ukraine, but the EU has already indicated it won't accept the deal.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. has proposed a peace plan for Russia and Ukraine, but the EU has already indicated it won't accept the deal.
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Jobs Report offers mixed picture of the economy
item.description: U.S. employers added 119,000 jobs in September, but hiring was weaker than expected. That's according to a new report from the Labor Department, which was delayed because of the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: U.S. employers added 119,000 jobs in September, but hiring was weaker than expected. That's according to a new report from the Labor Department, which was delayed because of the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: A Venezuelan stargazer is sharing his passion while trying to stay in the U.S.
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans have lost their legal right to stay in the U.S., among them an amateur astronomer sharing his love of stargazing as he tries to secure a visa.
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans have lost their legal right to stay in the U.S., among them an amateur astronomer sharing his love of stargazing as he tries to secure a visa.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Alaska wants financially strained districts to take ownership of rural schools
item.description: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling rural schools. But now it wants cash-strapped districts to take on ownership of those buildings in exchange for funding to fix them.
item.content:encoded: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling rural schools. But now it wants cash-strapped districts to take on ownership of those buildings in exchange for funding to fix them.
item.dc:creator: Emily Schwing

item.title: The first 'Wicked' movie was about growing up. 'Wicked: For Good' is about wising up
item.description: Wicked: For Good is out this weekend, and while the prequel-sequel may not feel quite as worthwhile as Part 1, Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande are two powerhouse voices.
item.content:encoded: Wicked: For Good is out this weekend, and while the prequel-sequel may not feel quite as worthwhile as Part 1, Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande are two powerhouse voices.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Chris Thile is taking Bach on location in latest recording
item.description: Grammy-winning mandolin player Chris Thile is out with a new album. This time he is taking the music of J.S. Bach to different locations.
item.content:encoded: Grammy-winning mandolin player Chris Thile is out with a new album. This time he is taking the music of J.S. Bach to different locations.
item.dc:creator: Derek Operle

item.title: A struggling lumber industry wants to join farmers in government bailout package
item.description: The U.S. hardwood lumber industry is struggling because of past tariffs and a recent export ban to China. Now the industry says, just like soybean farmers, they need help.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. hardwood lumber industry is struggling because of past tariffs and a recent export ban to China. Now the industry says, just like soybean farmers, they need help.
item.dc:creator: Justin Hicks

item.title: 'It's Been a Minute' explores how to throw a dinner party
item.description: Government data indicates that Americans aren't throwing dinner parties as much as they used to, but there are good reasons to host them — and ways to ease the pressures of hosting.
item.content:encoded: Government data indicates that Americans aren't throwing dinner parties as much as they used to, but there are good reasons to host them — and ways to ease the pressures of hosting.
item.dc:creator: Brittany Luse

item.title: Why so many public schools are closing
item.description: Across the country, districts are reckoning with school closures. At many schools, enrollment is low, and funding depends on students. We look at public education and what's leading to low enrollment.
item.content:encoded: Across the country, districts are reckoning with school closures. At many schools, enrollment is low, and funding depends on students. We look at public education and what's leading to low enrollment.
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: Trump and Marjorie Taylor Greene had a falling out over Epstein. What changed?
item.description: Marjorie Taylor Greene rose to prominence as one of President Trump's most outspoken allies. But in recent months she's begun to criticize him. What is driving the shift?
item.content:encoded: Marjorie Taylor Greene rose to prominence as one of President Trump's most outspoken allies. But in recent months she's begun to criticize him. What is driving the shift?
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas
